subject: Home & DIY
title: Your Fridge Is an Energy Monster
description: A quick, practical guide to Your Fridge Is an Energy Monster.

hook.text: Your fridge runs 24/7/365. It's the only appliance that never turns off, and it accounts for 13% of kitchen electricity.

buildup.text: Older fridges (pre-2000) can use 3x more electricity than modern Energy Star models with the same capacity.

discovery.text: The biggest waste: opening the door. Each opening loses 25-40% of cold air, forcing the compressor to work harder.

twist.text: A full fridge uses less energy than an empty one. Thermal mass from food maintains temperature; air doesn't.

climax.text: Set your fridge to 3-4Â°C and freezer to -18Â°C for optimal food safety and energy use. Most run too cold.

punchline.text: The most expensive appliance runs on the schedule you never see.

quiz.question: Why does a full fridge use less energy than an empty one?
options: Food acts as thermal mass that maintains temperature better than air
The compressor senses weight and adjusts power output
Food insulates the walls from heat transfer
